IRS990.MissionDescription: To provide grants to colleges, universities, and other educational institutions; to hospitals and other health organizations with a primary interest in programs designed to increase the effectiveness or decrease the cost of medical care; and organizations whose customary and primary activity is to promote music, theatre, drama, history, literature, the arts, or other similar cultural activities.
IRS990.Description: Grants allocated in support of 501(c)(3) organizations. See Schedule I for 2010 grants approved.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: Expand collaboration with elderly care homes by offering a meal and music.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: Abbe Museum of Stone Age Antiquities

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: An exhibit that reveals the deep connection between the Wabanaki people and Mount Desert.
To expand public education efforts into seven underserved counties in Maine.

To support an outreach program that brings the orchestra's musicians to local schools.
An exhibit at the Bates College Museum of Art of the work of Morrocan-born artist Lalla Essaydi.
To retrofit the new music center with sound proofing, furniture, and instruments.
To finish the interior work of their new Heritage Center.
To purchase online catalog software and equipment to facilitate inter library lending.
To renovate Kresge Auditorium and purchase new technology.
To purchase a new, digital mammogram machine.
To build a new, larger library adjacent to other municipal buildings.
Ongoing funding for the Center's support programs.
To upgrade and redesign the website into a content management system.
To make repairs to the Center.
To create a performance piece, through Playback Theatre, that addresses the issue of bullying.
Restoration which will include the eave and gable walls, wall braces, and exterior finishes.
To create an on-site training room to improve the electronic on-line skills of staff.
To create a professional video production service that provides low-fee products for nonprofits and train CTN members in video production.
Railroads restoration which include restoration of coaches and school programs.
Funding to cover the costs of developing a comprehensive renovation plan for the center.
Funding to tour a production of 'The Miser' to local middle and high schools.
To construct a new barn and gravel parking lot to house large historical artifacts.
The second annual 'Four in Maine', an exhibit that features living Maine artists.
Equipment for the children's theater which include a storage barn, flats, stackable chairs.
To purchase management software and sample tracking for the biorepository.
To conduct a conditions assessment for the Brick House Historic District.
Continuing renovations to the Museum which include heating, flooring, and sheetrocking.
To restore the ceiling murals of Cumston Hall.

To fund locating and surveying of historical sites for documentation and further excavation.
To replace the leaking roof on the oldest barn in Harrison.
To replace parts of the main stair, cabin roofs, concrete piers, wiring and windows.
To purchase equipment to allow ALS and other patients the ability to communicate better.
Support for the College's elementary and high school programs.
To purcahse a new sleep monitoring system as a requirement of accreditation.
To make repairs to the library including a new roof, and a new heating and cooling system.
To purchase core equipment for the pharmaceutical lab.
To purchase equipment to accommodate obese and geriatric patients and prevent injury to staff.
To renovate the second and third floors of the William J. Ryan building.
To build a new library facility.

To increase access to behavioral health services by hiring a full-time LCSW.
To conduct a pilot program for online genetics classes for high school students.
Funding for the pre-development phase of restoration.
Funding to hire an Americorps volunteer and provide a match to Americorps funding.
To aid Lake Region middle school teachers to engage at-risk students in service-learning.
To hire a mentoring coordinator to recruit and match volunteer mentors with students.
Support to bring the LGR program to underserved high school students in Portland.
To support purchase of a fixed wing plane to increase the number of patients served.

To cover staff and training cost for the Corps.
Seed funding to develop a new Office of Career Resources and support an assistant director.
To support a Physician Orders for Life Sustaining Treatment (POLST) program.
To provide a basic e-book package to member libraries.

To replace the theater's faulty windows.

To help renovate the second floor of the library.

An effort to measure the unmet need of the community and create a portable library.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The Organization requires a completion report after one year.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Anne Vaillancourt, Executive Director for the Organization, receives compensation from Davis Educational Foundation, an unrelated organization, for services rendered to the filing organization. Anne's unrelated organization compensation was as follows: Salary: $34,921 Benefits: $5,096

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Rebekah Bucci and David Bucci have a family relationship.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The trustees have voted to change the definition of Supported Organization to include any governmental unit (including Indian tribal governments) or their integral parts to the extent contributions would be deductible under Section 170 of the Code--(i.e., used exclusively for public purposes).

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The executive director and the entire board of trustees review Form 990 prior to the document's filing, and the executive director signs the return.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Possible conflicts of interest are discussed by the trustees and staff at each regularly scheduled meeting. Where a potential conflict does exist, the trustees will disclose to the board and the disclosure will be noted in the minutes. If a real conflict exists, the trustee will abstain from voting and this action will be disclosed in the minutes.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy available to the public upon request. The Organization publishes its financial statements in its annual report which is available to the public on its website.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Changes in Net Assets or Fund Balances:

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The audit process has not changed from the prior year.

Per the declaration of the trust, a majority of the trustees shall be appointed by the representative supported organizations. The trustees determine the recipients of the Davis Family Foundation grants each year.
